atDirectives.name: @tailwind
atDirectives.description: Use the @tailwind directive to insert Tailwind’s `base`, `components`, `utilities`, and `screens` styles into your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Use @apply to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS.

atDirectives.name: @layer
atDirectives.description: Use the @layer directive to tell Tailwind which “bucket” a set of custom styles belong to. Valid layers are base, components, and utilities.

description.value: The **@container** CSS at-rule is a conditional group rule that applies styles to a containment context.
The **container-type** CSS property is used to define the type of containment used in a container query.
The **container-name** CSS property specifies a list of query container names used by the **@container** at rule in a container query.
The **container** shorthand CSS property establishes the element as a query container and specifies the name or name for the containment used in a container query.
